items.sentence: Can you see the woman standing behind Tom? That\'s Mary.
I can\'t believe you\'re going to ask Mary to marry you.
I can\'t blame Tom for something that was Mary\'s fault.
Tom waited for hours just to see Mary for a few minutes.
Tom walked up to one of the houses and knocked the door.
Tom was escorted out of the building by security guards.
Tom is the only one here who doesn\'t understand French.
Tom isn\'t the type of person who does things like that.
I thought that you said that you were scared to do that.
I don\'t want to say anything that might make Tom angry.
I ended up at Tom\'s place after walking around all day.
Why did you have to embarrass me in front of the others?
We can\'t thank you enough for all you\'ve done for Tom.
I never would\'ve imagined Tom would be able to do that.
Tom considered moving to Boston, but decided against it.
Tom shouldn\'t have any trouble finding a place to live.
Tom shouldn\'t have interfered with what Mary was doing.
Tom shouldn\'t have told Mary where he hid the diamonds.
Tom solved all the problems without his teacher\'s help.
I often don\'t express myself as well as I wish I could.
